title: Apple Oatmeal Bars
ingredients: ½-1 tablespoon water (to thin, if needed)
½-1 tablespoon water (to thin, if needed)

instructions_list: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
Line an 8x8 inch baking pan with parchment paper and set aside.
In a large bowl, whisk together the oats, flour, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, and brown sugar.
Add the grated apples and stir to combine.
In a small bowl, whisk together the applesauce, vanilla, and buttermilk until smooth.
Add this to the apple mixture and stir until everything is evenly moistened.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan (it will be thick) as evenly as possible.
Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean and the squares are golden brown.
Allow to cool in the pan, then lift out the parchment paper and slice into squares.
In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter.
Add the powdered sugar and maple syrup and stir until the glaze is smooth.
If necessary, add ½ to 1 tablespoon of water to thin it out.
Drizzle the glaze over the cooled oatmeal bars.
Store the squares at room temperature for 4-5 days, or freeze for up to 3 months.
description: These apple oatmeal bars are quick and easy to make and are the perfect snack. They're made with oats and apples for a filling, healthier snack that the kids will love!
